widget.name: label1358
widget.label: (TCP/IP port number to accept connections on)

widget.name: listener_port_add
widget.tooltip: Add an entry to the port list.
widget.label: Add

widget.name: listener_port_delete
widget.tooltip: Delete the selected entry from the port list.
widget.label: Delete

widget.name: listener_port_save
widget.tooltip: Save the port list to the .ports file.
widget.label: Save

widget.name: listener_enable
widget.tooltip: Enable access to the following command buttons.
widget.label: Enable

widget.name: listener_start
widget.tooltip: Start the listener process.
widget.label: Start

widget.name: listener_restart
widget.tooltip: Signals the listener process to re-read the port list.
widget.label: Restart

widget.name: listener_stop
widget.tooltip: Stops the listener process, player connections will no longer be accepted, metaserver may delist your server.
widget.label: Stop

widget.name: metaserver_list
widget.tooltip: The list of metaservers that your server will send solicitation messages to in order to have players turn up.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_port_number
widget.tooltip: The port number at the metaserver that your server is to send the solicitation messages to. The default port is 3521, and should not be changed unless the metaserver administrator says so. Choosing the wrong port will simply delist your server.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_minimum_update_time
widget.tooltip: The minimum update interval in seconds. The code forces this to a minimum of 60, because if you reduce it below 60 the metaserver will delist your server for flooding. Come on, once a minute is probably enough, eh?

widget.name: metaserver_entry_server_host_name
widget.tooltip: The DNS host name of your server. This may well be different to the server host name, especially if you are using DNS aliases. This is the address that clients will connect to.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_player_port
widget.tooltip: The port number to which players should connect. The default is 2592. If you have multiple servers on your machine, you may have to change this for one of the servers.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_observer_port
widget.tooltip: The port number for observers to connect to. The default is 2593.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_additional_comments
widget.tooltip: Comments that you want sent to the metaserver. It is a good idea to include your electronic mail address, so that the metaserver administrator can contact you if she needs to.

widget.name: label1383
widget.label: (Fully qualified domain name or IP address)

widget.name: metaserver_entry_maximum_update_time
widget.tooltip: This is the maximum update time in seconds. It is the interval that must elapse before the server will repeat a solicitation that has not changed since the last solicitation sent to a particular metaserver.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_server_type
widget.tooltip: What type of server is this? Enter a letter from the list on the right. Failure to get the right letter will of course result in clients not listing your server.

widget.name: metaserver_entry_host_name
widget.tooltip: This is the address to which your server will send solicitation messages. The gethostbyname() call is issued once when the server daemon starts. You can enter an IP address, host name from /etc/hosts, or a DNS host name. Common names are metaserver.netrek.org, metaserver.us.netrek.org, and metaserver.eu.netrek.org.

widget.name: MOTD
widget.tooltip: The file to be displayed to players when they connect to the server, the Message Of The Day

widget.label: BB

widget.label: AS

widget.name: SHIPS_SB
widget.tooltip: Starbase, or outpost
widget.label: SB

widget.name: SHIPS_GA
widget.tooltip: Galaxy
widget.label: GA

widget.name: SHIPS_AT
widget.tooltip: God ship, once someone has one of these, none of the others make any sense whatsoever.
widget.label: AT

widget.name: HIDDEN_LABEL

widget.name: SBRANK_LABEL
widget.label: Rank required before refit to Stabase:
